primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God asserts His sovereignty over a creation that has made a 'covenant with death,' performing a 'strange work' of judgment to ultimately reveal His 'proper work' of mercy and resurrection.

subject.identificatie: God (The Holy One of Israel / YHWH)
tekstueel_bewijs: God remains separate from what he has made
God's right hand is concealed in his left

object.identificatie: The annulment of the covenant with death and the revelation of 'proper work' (mercy/salvation).
tekstueel_bewijs: your covenant with death will be annulled
death is swallowed up in victory
My thoughts are not your thoughts

ontvanger.identificatie: The Creation / The Victim (Yusef Hawkins) / The Repentant Society
tekstueel_bewijs: on behalf of those who are victims
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver of judgment/mercy and the Secondary Subject of repentance.

helper.identificatie: Christ (The Atonement) and the 'Right Hand' of God.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Son of God achieved the salvation of the world through suffering and death
He paid — he truly and fully paid
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent (Implicit in the 'rising up' of the Word)

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Sin (Racial Hatred), and Human Hubris (The desire to run the world).
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death and Sin are treated as active powers that 'scourge' and 'beat down' humanity, requiring a divine 'rising up' to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The call for the church/society to repent and share in Christ's sufferings.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / American Society
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Repentance is the human response to the 'left hand' (judgment) that opens the way to the 'right hand' (mercy).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's absolute 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where humans are incompetent and trapped in a covenant with death.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the 'Covenant with Death' (~S1) to the 'Alien Work' (S2), then through 'Repentance' (~S2) to the 'Proper Work' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the Cross: God's right hand is 'concealed' in His left; judgment is the instrument of mercy.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; judgment is described as 'sheer terror' and 'overwhelming scourge'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It resists the urge to provide human solutions to racial violence, instead pointing to God's sovereign action and Christ's substitutionary payment.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Call to national repentance as a condition
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: As nations repent... then we will begin to understand

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the sole agent of victory over death
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Ultimately it depends, not on us at all, but on the God who is God
He paid — he truly and fully paid — for the death of Yusef Hawkins

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Isaiah, Paul, Jeremiah) are used as witnesses to God's character, not as moral models for the hearer to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the Potter; we are the clay.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Humility and awe; relief that the 'running of the world' is not in human hands.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God rescues the helpless from their own 'covenants with death'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of God's 'two hands' perfectly integrates the reality of sin/judgment with the promise of grace.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's sovereignty and the 'vile' reality of the murder.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He paid — he truly and fully paid — for the death of Yusef Hawkins

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the external Word and the work of the Son rather than the internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is a 'covenant with death' that leads to 'sheer terror'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject. The 'Opponent' (Death/Sin) is sufficiently heavy, making the 'Subject's' (God's) intervention necessary and gracious.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition from 'God's work' to 'our work' at the very end is brief but appropriate.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's rising) precedes and enables Ethics (Repentance/Work).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterpiece of theocentric preaching that refuses to simplify the 'strange work' of God while anchoring everything in the finished work of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'I' persona and the Bensonhurst anecdote; Greimas shows these are subordinate to the actant 'God'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah's context; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' mirrors the biblical movement from Law to Gospel.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'left hand/right hand' metaphor is actually a sophisticated mapping of the Axis of Power and the Semiotic Square.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a textbook example of Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'.
